ardhel Terov was a fellthane among the Warlock Knights of Vaasa and an ambitious merchant in the late 15 century DR.
Kardhel was a tall human with pale skin, iron-gray hair, and a normally clean-shaven face with a strong jawline. As a result of his forming the pact with Telos that all Warlock Knights took, his eyes were a deep, bloody crimson. 
Terov was manipulative and cold. He was always unflappably calm, with an iron will that he used to suppress showing any anger or frustration in his negotiations. He was quick to offer and require that those with whom he made deals swear upon his pact ring, and thus partake in the pact of the iron ring to compel both parties to uphold their end of the bargain.
Among Terovs possessions was his heavy ironfell pact ring carved with dire runes, which he wore on his finger and which was not removable.
When he though he might be going into danger, Kardhel wore ebon plate mail with a black helm fitted with gilded rams horns curling from the sides. 
In Ches of the , Terov approached Mhurren of the Bloody Skulls orc tribe, offering the warchief his own kingdom of Thar in exchange for an oath of fealty and an agreement not to endanger cities under Kardhels protection. Wanting to have a protected trade route from Vaasa to the Moonsea, he provided the chieftain with arms, armaments, monsters, and the loyalty of several other Tharran tribes, which Mhurren then used to sack Glister and then march on Hulburg, where the army was defeated at the Battle of Lendons Dike in Tarsakh of that year.
Undeterred, he continued to try to bring Hulburg into Vaasas orbit, first by trying to undermine the city and the Hulmaster family by supporting Valdarsel, a follower of Cyric stoking discontent and violent among the populace in mid-to-late 1479 DR, and then by offering power and protection to the usurper Rhovann Disarnnyl in Alturiak of the .
